title: What acronyms or abbreviations are used frequently on Quora? What do they mean? - Quora

response.answer_text: On Quora, you'll encounter a couple of abbreviations and acronyms that you've probably never seen before (speaking from personal experience): A2A – Ask to Answer (discontinued feature), now replaced by “Request Anwers”BNBR – Be Nice, Be Respectful (Quora policy) is how you should treat Quora users: "with civility and respect"limdist – Limited Distribution Topics (discontinued feature)MVW – Most Viewed Writers (Quora feature)NFR – Not for Reproduction (Quora feature)NI – Needs Improvement (discontinued feature)OP – Original Question Poster on QuoraQC – Quora CommunityQCR – Quora Content Review (system)QTB – Quora Topic BotQTCA – Question That Contains AssumptionsTQW – Top Question Writers (Quora program)TW (also: QTW) – Top Writer (Quora program)X – placeholder used for grouping topics together, as in e.g. Best of X or What "X" Questions

I'll make a start on this and add more as I come across them or they occur to me:  A2A = ask to answer (Request Answers (Quora Feature))BNBR = Be Nice, Be Respectful (What is Quora's "Be Nice, Be Respectful" policy?)NI = Needs Improvement (What is the appropriate use for the various Needs Improvement and limited distribution topic tags?)OP = original posterthe person who posted a question or answer to which others have responded by way of answers or comments (not Quora-specific).QC = Quora Community (How should the Quora Community and Survey Question topics be used?)RTB = Recognized Topic Bio(What topics have recognized topic biographies? What are the rules about topic-specific bios?)In general, I think Quora uses a lot fewer acronyms than many other sites, and a heck of a lot fewer than Wikipedia!
